answers.answer: Ever heard of a VBAC? Maybe you might not need a C-section. .. ask your doctor about a VBAC
Whats a vbac . She said I had to get a cestion because I already  had one .
I had csection with my first n I did vbac with my second they 15months apart n planning to have vbac with my third child in jan..
My children are 17 months apart c-sections with both. Both went well. Vbac is vaginal birth after cesarean. Ask your doctor.
A VBAC is Vaginal Birth After Cesarean. .. it's possible that they don't have to do another C-section
I guess there scared for my blood pressure gets high on my third trimester I had my son at 33weeks 4pound so there really scared for.this pregnancy

Yea once a csection airways a csection is sooo not acceptable anymore. There is no reason you can't have a vbac if your a good candidate. If you really don't want another cesarean id say find a new doctor asap that well do one. I did abd ill be having a vbac in December :-)
Just hope everything goes well for you... Just think positive and don't stress to much and maybe this pregnancy will go smoothly for you

I delivered my first baby July 18, 2013 via cesarean and a month or so shy of a year I'm preggars again (17.3 wks). I was high risk last time around and this time I'm considered as having a normal pregnancy but due to a fibroid being directly in the baby's escape route, i have to get another c section.  I had such a lovely experience the first time around (despite the hours of labor before the dr decided on a cesarean) that I'm looking forward to this process.I think all will go well with your c section and especially because you were high risk the first time around, so, that definitely means the doctor's will ensure that every step in your delivery process is well thought out. This time around doctors will be even more prepared than they were the first time around. Best wishes and congrats on baby...you'll have a breezy and extra safe delivery.

I had my first at 34weeks 6lbs 11oz with csection and my second at 33weeks 6lbs with vbac..doctors will try to scare u with all the things they say but u gotta be willing to try to take the risk.. I would never have csection again if I dont have to.. feels great to be able to walk to the bathroom on your own after 15mins of giving birth!!!
Yes maybe I need to change my doctor seems like everytime.i go in they find somthing to scared me with can even have a happy pregnancy I always exspect them to say something negative

Aww yea huny that's not a healthy or good thing :-( im sry. Your appt should be reassuring and positive and your needs met and talked about. I would definitely recommend a new doctor. I researched doctors online then called their offices and the ones that would let me schedule a consultation appt are the ones I talked to lol I find the perfect doctor for me very quickly and im very happy with her abd her natural approach to labor and birth etc. And she is so 100% vbac if possible :-) she has a very good outlook for me! :-) I love her office, the staff her nurse everything lol. Good luck huny I hope things work out for you! :-) best of luck.

I had a cesarean August 5, 2013. It was solely because of placenta previa and absolutely not what I wanted, but it was the safest way for me and my daughter. I am now 7 weeks pregnant and have just moved to another state, so I was able to really search around for a good VBAC doctor. I haven't met with him just yet, but the nurse I met with was very reassuring on how many women really do have VBACs here with this doctor. I still have many questions to ask him personally, but it looks very possible right. However, the chance of me having placenta previa again is much higher than that of me having it in the first pregnancy (which was 1%), so you never know what will happen the further along you get. You might want to check around and see if other doctors agree with your current doctor or not. I found this blog to have extremely helpful. It is about questions to ask when considering VBAC.http://walkingwithdancers.blogspot.com/2013/10/questions-to-ask-provider-when-hoping.html?m=1I hope that everything works out for you and that, in the end, you come home safely with a healthy baby!

question: Kind of scared has anyone had a csection then got pergnant a year later and has to get another one . They say im high risk because my first I had preeclampsia im 19 weeks now nothing so far I just want a safe csection so nervous
title: csection question
